title: Fuel leak blamed for Falcon 9 booster loss after landing
summary:
A Falcon 9 booster that was destroyed after landing March 2 suffered a fuel leak during its flight that triggered a fire.

title: FCC allows a power boost for SpaceX’s direct-to-smartphone service
summary:
SpaceX secured permission March 7 to provide direct-to-smartphone satellite services at higher power levels to improve connectivity beyond the reach of cell towers across the United States.

title: NASA Earns Best Place to Work in Government for 13th Consecutive Year
summary: For the 13th straight year, NASA has earned the title of Best Place to Work in the Federal Government – large agency – from the Partnership for Public Service. The ranking reflects employee satisfaction and workplace elements across the agency while executing NASA’s mission to explore the unknown and discover new knowledge for the benefit […]

title: U.S. halts satellite imagery support to Ukraine in major policy shift
summary:

title: Cosmic Mapmaker: NASA’s SPHEREx Space Telescope Ready to Launch
summary: NASA’s latest space observatory is targeting a March 8 liftoff, and the agency’s PUNCH heliophysics mission is sharing a ride. Here’s what to expect during launch and beyond. title: Intuitive Machines’ IM-2 Moon mission ends with lander on its side
summary: A photo from the lunar lander, named Athena, shows it landed inside a crater roughly 250 m from its intended landing site. The spacecraft touched down on the Moon’s surface at 12:28:50 p.m. EST (1728:50 UTC), according to ham radio non-profit AMSAT-DL.
